channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Entrance to Weymouth Mews / at Weymouth Street east entrance, 16th August
item.description:
Black bin is always left at this location No bins should be allowed on the highway As the bin is here people dump other bags - see photos Also due to this there is broken glass which also needs cleaning please Please just remove this black bin and the problem will be solved Thank you Jeremy

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Weymouth Street, Marylebone, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing width restriction post, 16th August
item.description:
As the width restriction post is missing this will encourage speeding, vehicles travelling on the wrong side of the road and large vehicles accessing the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Watts Lane, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Racist word etched into arm of park bench, 16th August
item.description:
On the bench outside Canada Water station (library side) - can see the Decathlon shop directly across. I sat for lunch and saw this on the arm of the seat. I don’t know how long it has been present.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Surrey Quays Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Advertising sign attached to lamppost, 16th August
item.description:
These are all over this area (Blackheath Standard), some have now been removed, this one remains, eyesore. At the junction of Sunfields Place and Lizban Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Lizban Street, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Turkish man with a large German shepherd dog was off lead attacking other park users and their dogs. Dangerous dog off leash roaming around park near kids play area.authority need to address this issues., 16th August
item.description:
Dangerous dog running around out to control. After dog tried attacking another dog owner and dog owner managed to get it onleash. ASB

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lee Conservancy Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big litter problem in Rectory Lane, 16th August
item.description:
We have reported this litter problem twice already and each time it gets dismissed as a problem. There would be two large bag fulls of litter in approx 400m of road! It’s disgusting and need rectifying by the council. Please take the relevant action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food feces drugs paraphernalia dumped in Craig's Court, 16th August
item.description:
Many bags dumped outside bt exchange - sitting there for days, wooden palets left for weeks, feces in front of Silver Cross fire exit crushed glass everywhere; food - attracting vermin, drugs paraphernalia.... why / how is this acceptable ? fine businesses causing this and put a stop to this it's not fair on the residents and it's endangering public health and safety !

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Craig's Court, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Fridge, 16th August
item.description:

item.title: Overgrown hedges, 16th August
item.description:
Second request for hedgerow cutting. It is dangerous exiting the driveway as vision is obscured by vegetation. The shrub in middle of hedgerow is now second storey high. It’s a shrub not a tree. on first posting Idverde visited and cut hedges opposite which didn’t require any action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 111, Wickham Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipped rubbish at top of Aldeburgh Street, 16th August
item.description:
This fly-tipped rubbish is impeding the passage of buggies, wheelchairs and pedestrians. It looks unsightly and is a magnet for further fly-tipped trash. It has been reported multiple times but is yet to be cleared. We request that it be taken away. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aldeburgh Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
